title: Memory of Timothy Leary
historical_context: Timothy Leary was a prominent psychologist and advocate for psychedelic drugs, known for his controversial views on consciousness and technology. His passing in 1996 marked the end of an era in counterculture.
target_audience: Hackers, phreakers, and individuals interested in counterculture and the intersection of technology and consciousness.
short_summary: This article reflects on the life and legacy of Timothy Leary, recounting a personal encounter with him and his unique perspective on life and technology. It captures the essence of Leary's influence on the hacker and counterculture communities.
summary:
In 'Memory of Timothy Leary,' Weasel Boy shares a personal reminiscence of the late Timothy Leary, a figure synonymous with the psychedelic movement and a proponent of exploring consciousness through technology. The article opens with a humorous anecdote from a convention in Atlanta, where the author recounts an encounter with Leary and a peculiar woman known as 'Ms. Marvel.' This interaction highlights Leary's playful demeanor and his ability to engage with the eccentricities of those around him, embodying the spirit of the counterculture of the time.

The piece serves as both a tribute and a reflection on Leary's impact on the hacker community, emphasizing his belief in the potential of technology to expand human consciousness. Weasel Boy's narrative captures the essence of Leary's philosophy, suggesting that his journey continues even after his death. The article resonates with readers who appreciate the blend of technology, consciousness, and the quirky personalities that populate the hacker and counterculture scenes, making it a relevant read for those interested in the historical context of these movements.
